item.title: Digital Governance and the Promise of Blockchains in Supporting Democratic Systems
item.description: There’s a quiet revolution taking place in Asia’s boardrooms and policy circles. Blockchain technology represents a leap in both corporate governance and the emerging concept of digital governance. It changes how democratic systems build consensus and put power back into the hands of stakeholders. According to The Economist Intelligence Unit’s (EIU) 2021 Democracy Index survey, which ranks 167 countries across various factors, including their electoral processes, civil liberties, and levels of political participation, global freedoms hit a record low last year.

item.title: Ithaca: What Tenderbake and liquidity baking could mean for Tezos users
item.description: The Tezos Ithaca upgrade brings several improvements to Tezos’ consensus model, including deterministic finality and a shift away from a roll-based model to an optimized stake-based model. In this article, we take a deep dive into some of these changes â€“ and what they mean for users. The Ithaca upgrade to the Tezos protocol proposes an improved finality model, Tenderbake, and extends the liquidity baking of the Tezos network. Here we cover how the Ithaca proposal would achieve faster blockchain finality, how it improves on the Granada proposal’s Emmy* consensus, and what this all means for Tezos’ users.
